Ad Text:
We're reimagining the way Australians live, work, and play. We own and manage some of the most recognisable and loved retail destinations across Australia.

 
We’re evolving our portfolio into destinations that offer a broad selection of retail, residential, and office spaces. Through our diverse portfolio, data-led decision-making, and nationwide development pipeline, we do things differently.




We are Vicinity.




Role purpose

The key purpose of the Senior Business Analyst is to play a strategic role in understanding business needs and enabling technological solutions that provide real business value. The Senior Business Analyst contributes to the achievement of the overall business strategy by providing insights and recommendations for technology supported solutions based on comprehensive analysis of organisational strategy, processes and systems, and data. This role collaborates with a broad range of stakeholders and multiple business units to enable them to understand the problem, define project outcomes, gather, analyse, validate requirements, and develop a project strategy.


Key Accountabilities


People Leadership    

All elements of the annual performance cycle are completed by the due date (including goal setting, mid-year reviews, EOY conversations).

Regular 1:1’s, team meetings and development conversations conducted - minimum monthly cadence.

Performance issues are managed in an effective and timely manner.

Quarterly development conversations conducted with all team members.

100% of compliance training is completed on time for team.

All health and safety, risk and compliance requirements are delivered across the team.

Effective management of budgets as per forecast with demonstrated focus on managing cost.

Demonstrated commitment to building own capability as a people leader.


Stakeholder Engagement & Relationship Management    

Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, enabling an in-depth understanding of cross-business functions, how they interrelate, and contribute to overall organisational strategy.

Collaborate with key business stakeholders to identify enterprise-wide opportunities and validate business value that aligns with the overall business strategy.

Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences to ensure a shared understanding of requirements, outcomes, and project status.




Business Analysis & Solution Development    

Tackle complex and high-impact business problems, offering innovative insights and achievable solutions, ensuring alignment with organisational goals and challenges.

Prepare, perform, and coordinate elicitation of requirements, including brainstorming, workshops, prototyping, observation, or interviews. Assess current state, synthesise results, and provide actionable insights for technology-supported solutions.

Create business personas and user stories, ensuring that business outcomes are captured and replayed to stakeholders for validation.

Work with technical teams to ensure that solution designs address business needs and outcomes and align with technology capabilities.


Documentation & Requirements Management    

Create detailed documentation for solution design, including business requirements, functional specifications, and process workflows.

Ensure documentation is clear, comprehensive, and aligned with organisational standards, supporting business and technical teams throughout the project lifecycle.


Project & Change Management    

Prepare business change and communication plans to support the implementation of technology solutions and process improvements.

Lead the gathering and documenting of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) requirements and participate in the review and validation of test cases to ensure they accurately represent the intended functionality.


Outcome Validation & Benefit Realisation    

Support business owners in defining outcomes, benefits, and measures of success, and verify and validate the value of improvements against these measures.


Leadership & Mentorship    

Provide leadership and mentorship to Business Analysts, guiding their development and ensuring alignment with best practices and organisational objectives.


Key Role Relationships

Functional Business Owners

Functional Team Leads

Functional SMEs

Technology Teams


Experience & Capabilities


ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE (what you have done)    

5 or more years of experience as a Senior Business Analyst or in a similar analytical role.

Excellent stakeholder and relationship management skills with a demonstrated ability to work with a cross section of technology and business stakeholders.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Demonstrated experience in delivering a broad range of Business Analyst artefacts.


CRITICAL KNOWLEDGE (what you need to know)    

Understanding of business strategy and organisational goals and challenges and how individual business units contribute.

Understanding and experience in both agile and waterfall methodologies and an ability to work across a blend of both dependent on project and business needs.


CAPABILITIES (what you can do)    

Ability to analyse organisation and departmental strategy, processes and systems, and data, current pain points and problems to be solved, and synthesise into actionable insights and recommendations that will drive business value.

Effective information gathering techniques to proactively uncover requirements and synthesise information accurately and coherently and provide actionable insights.

Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.

Ability to self-organise and meet deadlines.

Ability to lead and motivate teams including managing conflict.

An adaptable and experimentation enterprise mindset with a commitment to continuous improvement.

Familiarity with project management methodologies, tools, and techniques.


PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES (who you are)    
You consistently demonstrate and role model the behaviours that bring the Vicinity values to life: 


Respect: 

We listen to and acknowledge each other's views 

We have difficult conversations with care 


Integrity: 

We back our words with the right actions

We do the right thing, no matter the situation 


Customer Focus: 

We nurture a genuine connection with our customers 

We consider customer needs when making decisions 


Collaboration: 

We invite the right people to the table 

We balance consensus with decisive actions 


Excellence: 

We always strive to improve

We share our challenges and celebrate the wins
 

Why Vicinity?




Our benefits program focuses on creating an awesome place to work in which our people are rewarded and recognised. This includes:

Flexible working options 

Birthday leave & purchased additional leave

$1,000 worth of VCX securities rewarded for eligible team members

Internal mentoring program

Generous Parental Leave

We live and work by our values of Respect, Integrity, Customer Focus, Collaboration and Excellence.  They are the foundation to everything we do and provide us a north star with which we can shape meaningful places where communities connect.




At Vicinity we embrace and celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive work environment where we attract, retain and develop our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community.




Our people and our Employee Advocacy Groups (Gender Balance, Cultural Diversity, Disability & Access and Pride & Allies) actively build community and provide allyship within Vicinity. If you’d like to speak to someone to understand what it’s like firsthand to work here, please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team.




We are aware of current limitations with our website accessibility and are working towards improving this. Should you experience any issues accessing information in this job advertisement or the application form, and require this in an alternate format, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team. Similarly, if you would like to discuss workplace accessibility, any reasonable adjustments we can make to better support you during the recruitment process, or your potential future role please reach out to our Talent Acquisition team:




Email: talent.acquisition@vicinity.com.au

Phone: +61 3 7001 4000 (request to speak to our Talent Acquisition team)




Note: To be eligible to apply for this position, you must have existing, relevant Australian work rights. At the later stages of the recruitment process the shortlisted candidate/candidates will be required to undergo a Criminal History Background/Police Check as a mandatory part of the process. Additional qualification checks may also be required dependant on role and level.

About the Role:
We are seeking an experienced Investment Data Analyst to join a leading financial services organisation. This role plays a key part in ensuring data platforms and processes are optimised to deliver reliable, accurate and timely information across critical business functions. It involves analysing and improving end-to-end data flows, particularly between front office and middle office systems. The role requires translating business requirements into technical solutions, driving improvements in data quality, and supporting integration initiatives. It also involves producing high-quality documentation, contributing to solution design, and participating in test planning and execution.

What's a typical day look like?

Conduct end-to-end business and data analysis with a focus on transformation and optimisation.
Gather and document requirements, change requests, and integration specifications.
Input into solution design, data structures, and process decisions.
Develop and maintain technical documentation to support business outcomes.
Plan, design, and execute testing to validate solutions.
Build strong relationships and engage effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
Collaborate with external vendors and custodians to ensure seamless data and system integration.
About you:
Minimum 6 years experience in an Investment Data Analyst role within buy side funds 
MUST HAVE Funds and Investments experience 
Strong understanding of data flows between front and middle office functions.
Experience working with security data, classifications and mastering.
Familiarity with investment data vendors such as bloomberg. 
Experience across a wide range of financial instruments including equities, fixed income and OTC derivatives.
Exposure to regulatory reporting requirements.
Proficiency in SQL and advanced Microsoft Office skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication, facilitation and negotiation skills.
Proven ability to understand complex processes and translate them into actionable requirements.

Reach out to Amaleen on Amaleen.ibrahim@kapital.com.au or apply directly with your updated resume. 

Kapital Consulting is a niche Fintech Recruitment Business specialising in Technology, Project Services and Data Recruitment across Australia. For more information connect with us on www.kapitalconsulting.com.au and follow us on www.linkedin.com/company/kapital-consulting

Business Analyst - Digital Marketplace

6 month contract starting asap
 
We are seeking a highly capable Business Analyst to join our client, a leading online marketplace. This role sits at the centre of digital transformation, working across cross-functional teams to deliver value in a fast-paced, agile environment.
 
Key Responsibilities

Process Mapping & Improvement - Lead process mapping, value stream mapping, and process improvement initiatives to optimise marketplace operations.
Agile & Lean Delivery - Work within an agile scrum framework, contributing to a culture of continuous improvement and lean delivery.
Change & Transformation - Support organisational change, transformation, and adoption of new ways of working.
Facilitation & Requirements Gathering - Engage stakeholders to gather, analyse, and document business requirements with clarity and precision.
Cross-Functional Collaboration - Partner with strategy, commercial, product, analytics, and governance teams to align initiatives with business objectives.
Marketplace Rollout - Contribute to the design, governance, and rollout of marketplace functionality in a dynamic, growth-focused environment.
About You

Experienced in business analysis within digital or technology environments.
Skilled in facilitation, requirements gathering, and stakeholder engagement.
Strong understanding of marketplace models and cross-functional operations.
Comfortable working in fast-paced, agile/lean environments.
Able to manage ambiguity, change, and transformation with resilience.
What's on Offer

Opportunity to shape the future of a growing online marketplace platform.
Collaborative and innovative digital environment.
Work across diverse teams driving commercial, strategic, and analytical outcomes.

Senior Analytics Engineer-WMP




Exciting Greenfields projects with true business impact.
Drive Data Driven decision making across our portfolio of Group Marketplace Businesses
Surry Hills Location with hybrid Working (3 days in the office)




We are Woolworths Group

We are Woolworths Group. 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives connected by a shared Purpose – ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.’ It’s that Purpose that fuels our ambition to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week. 




Woolworths Market Plus (WMP) is Woolworths Group’s marketplace platform business.  WMP enables Group-wide marketplaces to provide customers with greater choice and value, leveraging One Seller Door - an enhanced third-party seller proposition and One Platform - efficient and scalable tech and operations.  







What you’ll do

As Senior Analytics Engineer  you will  be partnering with strategy and business teams to define high-impact use cases and work backwards to develop reusable, well-documented, and unified data assets, driving actionable insights to support portfolio growth. You’ll leverage your expertise in dbt, BigQuery SQL, and LookML (Looker) to transform raw data into actionable intelligence, applying data science skills to uncover hidden patterns and opportunities.




This role is split roughly between use case identification and prioritisation (40%), data asset development (40%) and data science and analytics (20%):




Design and develop reusable data models, metrics, and dashboards in Looker that provide a unified view of marketplace performance across the portfolio, enabling consistent analysis and reporting.
Leverage dbt to develop and maintain efficient data pipelines in BigQuery that extract, transform, and load data from various sources, harmonising disparate schemas and ensuring data quality and consistency across business units.
Apply statistical methods and machine learning techniques to analyse data across the portfolio of businesses, identifying cross-business trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimisation.
Develop predictive models and algorithms that leverage shared data to forecast key metrics and inform strategic decision-making across the portfolio.
Apply statistical methods and machine learning techniques to analyse data across the portfolio of businesses, identifying cross-business trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimisation.
Develop predictive models and algorithms that leverage shared data to forecast key metrics and inform strategic decision-making across the portfolio.







What you’ll bring 

Your exceptional communication and interpersonal skills  will assist you to effectively partner with stakeholders to drive data-informed decision-making




Proven experience integrating and standardising disparate datasets, aligning metric definitions, and resolving data quality issues across the portfolio of businesses.
Exceptional SQL skills for querying, transforming, and analysing large datasets within BigQuery, with a focus on efficiency, scalability, and cross-dataset compatibility.
 Proven ability to design and implement flexible and scalable data models that can accommodate the diverse needs of multiple portfolio businesses, while promoting standardisation and reusability.
 Expertise in using dbt for transformation and LookML for data modelling in Looker, demonstrating a commitment to best practices and data quality.
A strong understanding of business strategy and the ability to translate business needs into data-driven solutions that drive tangible outcomes.







What you’ll experience

Our Team Members are at the heart of everything we do and we’re always looking for ways to support your career journey and reward great work:




A global business with endless career possibilities around every corner and across every discipline – with valuable exposure to a vast and exciting business network.
Team discounts across our range of Woolworths Group brands you know and love and a robust rewards program that celebrates and incentivises purpose-driven work.
12 weeks paid parental leave for primary caregivers plus paid superannuation for up to 12 months while the Team Member is on parental leave - eligible from the first day of employment
A range of programs to help you prioritise and manage your wellbeing, including 24/7 access to the Sonder app.
A progressive and competitive leave policy that gives you more space for what matters to you.  







Everyone belongs at Woolworths Group 

As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best selves, and reach their full potential.




Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are key to realising our purpose of better together for a better tomorrow. We recognise the value our team’s diversity brings to our business, customers, and communities and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems. 

Woolworths Group is an inclusive, team-first company and we value all skills and experiences. If you meet some, but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to submit your application.

At AustralianSuper, we truly care about our colleagues. We know work and life are intertwined. That's why we support the diverse needs of everyone and have policies that enable us all to thrive and be truly flexible. We ensure diversity is celebrated for the opportunity it provides us all to learn and grow, and deliver better outcomes for members.

Your New Role

Reporting to the Manager, Business Analysis, this role involves working closely with the business initiative owners, internal subject matter experts, tech partners and other stakeholders to elicit relevant information in order to define and document business requirements, perform analysis, provide advice and support the delivery of projects/initiatives undertaken by Member Experience department.

The role primarily involves contributing to initiatives and projects across our digital channels, including the public website, member portal, mobile app, and B2B platforms.

This is a 6-month contract.

Some of your duties will include, but not limited to:


Gather and define requirements that impact our digital channels

Analyse, understand and derive actionable insights from all member sentiment sources to inform improvements to member experience

Enhance member experience across all channels by leading continuous improvement efforts and fostering an ongoing cycle of uplift.

Define, prioritise and support delivery of the required changes, in partnership with Technology


What You'll Need

Experience as a business analyst working on successful delivery of significant projects / initiatives
Digital & Superannuation experience is advantageous

Proven ability to successfully gather requirements and get results with minimal supervision

Understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate these into operational requirements

Demonstrated ability to write clearly and succinctly and present complex analysis in accessible formats; experience with digital agile methods including user stories etc

Ability to synthesise member preferences, regulatory requirements and the Fund's strategic ambitions to identify workable and measurable solutions with a member experience lens

Knowledge of various digital platforms that can drive better customer interactions.

Strong interpersonal skills with proven ability to build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders

Excellent verbal skills and the ability to interact professionally and influence a diverse group, executives, managers and subject matter experts


Life at AustralianSuper

AustralianSuper is committed to colleague development, and we support our people with ongoing learning, coaching and training, as well as career opportunities across our expanding global organisation. We offer generous leave entitlements and promote a blended working environment in which all roles can flex, and we're happy to discuss what this looks like for you.

We cultivate a workplace that champions safety, respect, inclusiveness and diversity. We are committed to supporting our diverse workforce in a way that is inclusive and embraces diversity in all its forms. If you require any reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process or the role, please let our recruitment team know.

What's Next

Apply now, if you share our values of Energy, Integrity, Generosity of Spirit and Excellent Outcomes and would like the opportunity to work in a challenging, growing and rapidly evolving team to deliver outstanding results.

Australian or New Zealand citizenship or Australian permanent residency status is required.

Progress powered by purpose.

https://www.australiansuper.com/careers/candidate-privacy-notice

Agencies please note: this vacancy is being managed directly by AustralianSuper's Talent Acquisition team. We will contact our preferred agency partners should we require additional support. Thank you.

About the Opportunity

Join a top 5 general insurer in Australia and New Zealand, operating in a dynamic environment where you’ll contribute to key strategic initiatives. This high-profile role will see you partnering with senior leaders, driving performance, and leading a small team of analysts to deliver meaningful insights.

What You’ll Be Doing

Act as a trusted partner to business units, providing commercial insights and financial advice to influence strategic decision-making.
Deliver high-quality financial analysis, including performance commentary, competitor reviews, and insights for senior management, boards, and external stakeholders.
Lead budgeting and forecasting processes across P&L, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow, ensuring alignment with group objectives.
Manage legal entity reporting requirements, including transfer pricing for foreign branches and subsidiaries.
Drive process and system improvements, enhancing FP&A tools and reporting capabilities (including Power BI).
Oversee, mentor, and develop a team of 1–2 FBP Analysts.
Provide ad hoc analysis and financial modelling to support business-critical projects, including asset valuations and strategic growth initiatives.
What We’re Looking For

CA/CPA (or equivalent) with extensive experience in FP&A, commercial finance, or business partnering.
Strong insurance industry knowledge, with an understanding of AASB 17 and underwriting/expense management.
Proven leadership ability, with experience managing and developing people.
Advanced financial modelling and analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, capable of engaging and influencing stakeholders at all levels.
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the drive to take initiative and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.
Why This Role?

Join a top-tier insurer with a reputation for innovation and collaboration.
Work in modern, flexible spaces that support hybrid and remote working.
Career growth opportunities across a large and diverse finance function.
Competitive benefits, including flexible work options, employee discounts, wellbeing initiatives, and ongoing professional development support.
Interested? Apply now!

Reports To: Director, Data & AI Consulting 

Role Purpose 

The Senior Data & Analytics Architect plays a pivotal role in designing and delivering enterprise-grade data solutions across global markets. This role demands deep technical expertise in cloud-native platforms—particularly Databricks—alongside a strategic consulting mindset shaped by experience in Big 4 environments. The architect will lead cross-functional teams, drive innovation, and ensure data platforms are scalable, secure, and aligned with business goals. 

Key Responsibilities 

1. Architecture & Solution Design 

Lead the design and implementation of lakehouse architectures using Databricks, Delta Lake, and Spark 

Architect scalable data solutions across Azure, GCP, Snowflake, and AWS 

Integrate data platforms with BI tools, ML pipelines, and enterprise systems 

2. Consulting & Client Engagement 

Deliver strategic data advisory services to clients across APAC, Europe, and North America 

Translate complex business requirements into technical solutions 

Present architecture roadmaps and governance frameworks to executive stakeholders 

3. Platform Engineering & Operations 

Establish DataOps functions for cloud-based platforms 

Oversee CI/CD pipelines, DevOps automation, and MLOps enablement 

Ensure platform reliability, performance, and cost optimization 

4. Governance & Quality Assurance 

Define and enforce data quality, lineage, and confidence frameworks 

Conduct governance reviews and lead compliance initiatives 

Develop monitoring dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, and Looker 

5. Team Leadership & Delivery Management 

Manage multi-disciplinary teams across geographies 

Lead project planning, resource allocation, and delivery oversight 

Mentor junior architects and engineers 

Required Skills & Experience 

13+ years in data architecture, engineering, and consulting 

Proven experience in Big 4 or Tier 1 consulting firms 

International project delivery experience across Australia, India, and global client bases 

Deep expertise in Databricks, Spark, Delta Lake, MLflow 

Strong command of Python, PySpark, SQL, Shell scripting 

Hands-on experience with ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, IICS) and DevOps tools (Terraform, Airflow, Azure DevOps) 

Familiarity with agile methodologies and enterprise data governance 

Certifications 

Databricks Certified Data Engineer Associate 

Microsoft Azure Data Engineer Associate 

Snowflake SnowPro Core Certification 

Oracle PL/SQL Developer Certified Associate 

Certified Scrum Master (CSM) 

Education 

Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech) in Computer Science  

Preferred Attributes 

Global mindset with cultural fluency across diverse teams 

Executive presence and stakeholder engagement skills 

Strategic thinker with a practical, delivery-focused approach

Role Overview
The Business Analyst will support delivery of enhancements within the department’s grant management system, working closely with the Project Manager, vendor, and business stakeholders. This role is pivotal in bridging business needs and technical solutions, ensuring requirements are well-documented, prioritised, and delivered effectively.

Key Responsibilities
Engage with stakeholders across the department to elicit, document, and validate requirements.
Translate business needs into functional and technical specifications for the system vendor and ICT teams.
Support the PM in planning and sequencing four discrete work packages.
Map current and future-state processes to identify gaps, improvements, and change impacts.
Assist with vendor and system testing activities, including UAT planning and coordination.
Develop supporting documentation such as business requirements, process maps, user stories, training materials, and change artefacts.
Provide clear communication and act as an intermediary between technical teams, vendor, and business users.
Candidate Profile
Proven experience as a Business Analyst on ICT projects, ideally within grant management, CRM, or SaaS platforms.
Strong skills in requirements gathering, process mapping, and documentation (BPMN/UML or equivalent).
Demonstrated ability to work with vendors to clarify requirements, resolve issues, and ensure system alignment with business outcomes.
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills across all organisational levels — executive leaders through to operational end users.
Experience supporting system testing, UAT, and change management activities.
Background in Queensland Government or similarly complex public sector environments (highly regarded).

Role - Business Analyst (Deployment)
Employment type - Contract (12-months)
Location - Full remote

Summary:


Seeking two Deployment Analysts to support the rollout of a new SAP PLM platform in Australia. This role involves assisting Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) in Product Development, Packaging, and Marketing as they transition from an Oracle-based system.

The successful candidate will be responsible for business process documentation, ensuring data accuracy, and supporting testing and training activities. This is a chance to get hands-on experience with a major digital transformation.

**Please read** - We are seeking applicants with significant experience in the FMCG/CPG domain along with SAP. Candidates must be located in Victoria, Australia, have full working rights for a minimum of 12 months, and meet the specific knowledge and experience needed for the role. Please only apply if you fulfill this criteria.

Key Responsibilities:

Business Process Support

Help Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) document new business processes.

Align process changes with stakeholders across different teams.

Localize global training materials for the Australian market.

Data Preparation & Validation

Clean, validate, and analyze data for raw materials, packaging, recipes, and product hierarchies.

Work with global and local teams to prepare data for migration.

Testing & Deployment Readiness

Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) by tracking defects and their resolution.

Define and execute End-to-End (E2E) test scenarios with SMEs.

Create and manage all testing documentation and reports.

Qualifications & Experience
Education: Bachelor's degree in Information Systems or fields such as Food Science, Engineering, Supply Chain, Business

Professional Experience:

2-4 years in the CPG or FMCG industry.

Experience with R&D, Quality, Regulatory, Packaging, or ERP implementation projects is highly valued.

Previous experience supporting PLM or ERP deployments is a strong advantage.


If this sounds like you, someone you know, or you're ready for a confidential chat about your next career step, then apply below, or email nick.shannon@randstaddigital.com.au

At Randstad Digital, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

The Role

As the Commercial Analyst, you will undertake various duties to contribute to the business' renewables portfolio.

Key duties will include:

Financial modelling and analysis to assess project economics, financial feasibility and return on investment 
Analyse financial data, market trends and economic indicators
Evaluate investment opportunities in the renewable energy sector including M&A, joint ventures and partnership agreements
Ensure financial models are regularly updated with new energy forecasts
Scenario analysis and sensitivity testing
These roles will report into the Commercial Manager.

The Organisation

This business is one of Australia's leading renewable developers, specialising in development, construction, asset management and maintenance of renewable energy projects across the country.
Their growing portfolio comprises of Solar & BESS across NSW, Victoria
and QLD. 

This business is based in Manly, and offers 2 days WFH per week.

The Candidate

The successful candidate will possess:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or a related field. Advanced degree (MBA, MS Finance) is a plus.
1 - 3 year's relevant experience in financial modeling, financial analysis and reporting
Energy Sector experience desirable 
Strong proficiency in financial analysis, investment appraisal techniques, and sensitivity analysis.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial modeling tools.

The Opportunity 


This is a fantastic opportunity to join one of Australia's leading renewable developers as they undergo a major transformation and growth period, proving you with the opportunity to grow with the business. 

With over 400MW constructed and connected in the last 2 years, and 600MW in operation, this is a prime opportunity to contribute to Australia's energy transition in a flexible working environment that puts people first.

Job Title: Senior Technical Business Analyst / Solution Architect
Ad Text:
🧩 Position Description: Senior Technical Business Analyst / Solution Architect

📍 Location: Sydney, Australia

🕒 Employment Type: Full-Time

💼 Department: Enterprise Solutions & Data Strategy

📅 Reports To: Head of consulting

🎯 Role Overview

We are seeking a seasoned Senior Technical Business Analyst / Solution Architect to lead enterprise-wide digital transformation initiatives. The ideal candidate will bring over 15 years of experience in business analysis, solution architecture, and stakeholder engagement across telecom, IT services, and analytics domains. This role will drive strategic solutioning, data governance, and agile delivery across complex environments.

🔧 Key Responsibilities

Enterprise Solution Design

Lead the design and delivery of scalable enterprise solutions across CRM, BI, and data platforms.

Develop technical mapping documents and strategic roadmaps for managed services and analytics platforms.

Stakeholder Engagement & Agile Leadership

Facilitate backlog grooming, sprint planning, and cross-functional collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.

Coach Agile methodologies across squads and mentor Technical Product Owners.

Data Strategy & Governance

Architect data mesh integrations using platforms like Databricks Lakehouse.

Establish and enforce data governance frameworks and operational deployment processes.

Business Analysis & Process Reengineering

Conduct gap analyses, process mapping, and requirements lifecycle management.

Translate business needs into user stories and functional specifications.

Project Delivery & Transformation

Lead end-to-end delivery of strategic initiatives including VAT compliance, KPI automation, and customer segmentation.

Manage vendor coordination, reporting, and quality assurance across transformation programs.

🧠 Required Skills & Experience

15+ years in Business Analysis, Solution Architecture, or related roles

Proven experience in telecom, IT services, and enterprise analytics

Strong command of Agile/Scrum methodologies and backlog management

Expertise in tools: JIRA, Azure DevOps, Power BI, SQL, Cognos, Oracle SQL

Experience with data platforms: Teradata, Netezza, Databricks

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills

Familiarity with BPMN, integration analysis, and business process reengineering

🎓 Education & Certifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering

Certified Scrum Master

Agile Management & Business Planning Certifications

🏆 Preferred Attributes

Strategic thinker with a hands-on approach to delivery

Recognized for excellence in high-impact transformation projects

Multilingual: English plus others

Job Title: Technical Project Manager - Data Analytics Services
Category:
Programme & Project Management (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Position: Technical Project Manager - Data Analytics Services (Health Manager Level 4)

Employment Type: Full Time Exempt up to 4 years

Opportunity to work from our modern Chatswood or St Leonards Office
In-office presence with hybrid flexibility for work-life balance
Attractive salary, up to $169,151 + 12% Super and annual leave loading
Allocated day off per month, salary packaging, discounted fitness passport and more!
Join the team enriching health in millions of ways every day through digital innovation

Applications Close: 11:59pm, 22 September 2025

About the Opportunity

As Technical Project Manager of our Data Analytics Services at eHealth NSW, you will be responsible for overseeing the risk, quality, and progress of ICT projects in alignment with organisational standards, ensuring delivery on time, within budget, and to the required quality and scope.

This role plays a critical part in managing the onboarding of state-wide data assets into the NSW Health Enterprise Data Lake (EDL), supporting data asset migration to the Single Digital Patient Record (SDPR), and ensuring adherence to data governance frameworks and risk management protocols throughout the project lifecycle.

In this role, you will:

Drive the delivery of complex ICT and data projects - ensuring they land on time, within budget, and to the highest quality.
Lead cross-functional project teams and inspire collaboration across NSW Health, Pillars, and external partners.
Shape project outcomes by actively managing risk, quality, and scope, ensuring data governance and security standards are embedded throughout.
Build strong relationships with stakeholders through clear communication, proactive issue resolution, and trusted advice.
Champion continuous improvement by identifying opportunities to refine processes, unlock value, and deliver benefits faster.
Foster and sustain strategic partnerships across teams, Directorates, the wider Health agencies and relevant external agencies.

About you

We are looking for someone who:

Extensive experience in managing medium to large and/or complex technical Data and Analytics projects in a large and complex service industry organisation, including relevant project management qualifications or equivalent. This includes extensive knowledge and demonstrated experience ensuring projects are completed on time, on budget, to quality standards and within agreed scope.
Strong technical background and experience in delivering data integration, analytics, and reporting projects on cloud platforms like Snowflake, AWS, and Azure.
Deep understanding of data architecture, data governance, analytics, and cloud-based solutions.
Demonstrated experience managing and overseeing significant aspects of projects management and implementation, including developing and monitoring project plans, coordinating resources, reporting, issue and risk management and managing budgets.
Superior organisational skills and experience working in a high volume and demanding professional environment with proven capacity to prioritise, multi-task, achieve business goals, perform and always work with a customer focused approach.
Excellent interpersonal, influencing and negotiation skills with demonstrated experience engaging, collaborating, and influencing key stakeholders and customers to influence and achieve optimal business outcomes.

About Us – eHealth NSW

At eHealth NSW, we’re leading the digital transformation of Australia’s largest health system. As NSW Health’s digital centre of excellence, we design, build and support world-class ICT solutions that improve patient care across the state.

Guided by a Cloud First Strategy, we're harnessing digital technology to better patient care and deliver scalable, quality, patient-centred, digital healthcare. With your skills and experience, you can help enrich the lives of millions while developing your career within Australia’s largest health organisation - alongside passionate tech professionals, health partners and industry leaders building solutions that truly make a difference.

Working at eHealth

Our people are at the heart of who we are. We support our people with great benefits so they can enrich health in millions of ways every day:

Flexible work options
Professional growth and career development

Salary Packaging
Various health and wellbeing programs to support our team

How to apply

6 month contract 
Brisbane CBD with 2 days WFH 
HCMS Transformation | SAP SuccessFactors

This role is pivotal in ensuring that business benefits—across people, process, and technology—are identified early, tracked consistently, and realised in alignment with strategic goals.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement a Benefits Realisation Framework aligned with program objectives.
Establish baseline metrics and KPIs for tangible and intangible benefits.
Monitor benefit delivery progress in partnership with data owners and PMO.
Analyse post-implementation data to validate or adjust benefit forecasts.
About You You’re a strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for delivering value through transformation. You bring:

Proven experience in benefits realisation or business performance management within large-scale programs.
Strong understanding of SAP SuccessFactors, especially EC, ECP, Recruitment, and Onboarding.

Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills.

Are any of these you?

Have opinions on when to use MISP vs STIX?

Know how to make a CTI program actually deliver value?

Survived SOC alert fatigue—and learned how to fix it?

Know why attribution is hard?

If yes, let’s talk!

At Cosive, we’re a fully remote specialist consultancy in cyber threat intelligence and security operations. We work with leading organisations across Australasia and the rest of the world, helping them design smarter SecOps, build CTI sharing platforms, improve detection workflows, and make security teams more effective.

What we offer:

A flexible, fully-remote company (anywhere in AU/NZ)

Autonomy and trust – no clockwatching, just outcomes

Extra “Cosive ME Days” each month for mental health and wellbeing

Work with a small, passionate team on projects that actually make a difference

What we’re looking for:

5+ years in SecOps, IR, or CTI

Strong technical skills and problem-solving mindset

Excellent communication & consulting skills

Bonus points for scripting/dev, cloud, or automation experience


Senior Security Consultant Job Duties

Senior Security Consultants at Cosive are hands-on technical specialists in cyber threat intelligence (CTI) and/or security operations (SecOps). They are responsible for delivering high-quality outcomes for clients by applying deep technical expertise, structured methodologies, and practical problem-solving. This role is delivery-focused: Senior Security Consultants perform the bulk of the technical consulting work for clients, while also providing strategic insight where required.

Senior Security Consultants are responsible for working closely with clients to discern what goals they wish to achieve and then delivering to help them achieve those goals. This requires an ability to build close relationships with our clients and to listen to and understand their situation and needs, as well as having strong technical skills and strategic insights. The ideal candidate is someone who has strong cyber security experience, knows how to ask good questions of a client, analyse their problem, turn that into a plan, get feedback, and execute on that plan either themselves or with others in Cosive.

Our ideal candidate will be adept at engaging with stakeholders at all levels, both internally and externally. Internal engagement will be collaborating with other Cosive staff or board members in tactical, operational and strategic conversations. External engagement can be both at the CISO level as well as working with deep technical experts such as SOC analysts and CTI analysts to add value to their operations.  External networks and engagement skills are also important with peers and industry to demonstrate thought leadership and support to the wider industry. 

While not typical, there may occasionally be a requirement to attend client sites to perform work, primarily in Australia and New Zealand. Similarly, there may infrequently be a need to attend company meetings at locations chosen by Cosive. There may be opportunities to attend security conferences within Australasia and internationally. 

Senior Security Consultants may help deliver technical demonstrations and/or technical scoping discussions with clients or potential clients.  

Work hours are typically Australian or New Zealand office hours of 9am-5pm, with flexible working hours available if requested. Please note, you may be required to start early or work late in order to attend a video conference involving someone from another time zone and we expect our staff to accommodate that requirement where possible.

Important: Only Australian or New Zealand residents will be accepted for this role, and the successful candidate must undergo a police check before the position will be offered to them.




Your responsibilities

As a Senior Security Consultant at Cosive, your primary responsibility is to deliver high-quality consulting outcomes for our clients. This is a technical and hands-on role, where you will be expected to apply your expertise in cyber threat intelligence (CTI) and/or security operations (SecOps) to help clients improve their security posture.

Threat Intelligence & Security Operations Consulting

Design, implement, and optimise CTI processes, frameworks, and workflows.

Conduct threat intelligence informed modelling exercises tailored to client environments.

Perform CTI and SOC gap analyses to identify weaknesses and recommend improvements.

Carry out SIM3 and CTI-CMM maturity assessments and produce actionable recommendations.


Technical Delivery & Integrations

Build, configure, and integrate Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and related tooling. While Cosive works with many TIPs available in industry, we often work with EclecticIQ, MISP, and OpenCTI.

Support for our CloudMISP customers to guide their MISP usage and troubleshoot technical and integration issues.

Deliver proof-of-concepts (PoCs) for new integrations between CTI, SOC, and SOAR tools.

Evaluate, recommend, and implement improvements to security operations technology stacks.


Incident Response & Operational Improvement

Assist clients in developing and refining incident response plans and playbooks.

Provide recommendations and hands-on support to improve SOC operations and CTI functions.

Support clients with operational automation and process improvement initiatives.


Advisory & Continuous Improvement

Advise clients on best practices, frameworks, and emerging industry trends in SOC and CTI.

Collaborate with client stakeholders across technical and leadership levels to achieve project goals.

Capture lessons learned and feed them back into Cosive methodologies and service offerings.

Staying across developments in cyber security developments, best practices, frameworks, and tooling related to the SOC and CTI spaces

Keeping abreast of developments in automation, large language models, artificial intelligence and data visualisation as they relate to cyber


Deliver client consulting engagements

Work directly with clients to understand their security challenges and objectives.

Translate client requirements into actionable technical solutions and deliverables, both written and presented.

Build strong, trust-based relationships with client stakeholders at both technical and leadership levels.


Contribution to Cosive

Share expertise to help evolve Cosive’s consulting services, products, and internal processes.

Support the growth of junior consultants through knowledge sharing and mentorship.

Occasionally represent Cosive at conferences, industry forums, or client engagements.


Any other tasks as required




What we expect from you
Essentials

The primary skills and qualities we need you to have:

Strong background in Security Operations and / or Cyber Threat Intelligence.

Proven experience delivering technical and strategic consulting outcomes for customers.

Practical knowledge of at least one of the following: threat intelligence cycles, threat modelling, incident response planning, SOC/CTI process improvement, SOC/CTI tooling, threat informed defence.

Ability to analyse a SecOps or CTI team’s workflows and suggest improvements based on experience. This might be using SIM3, SOC-CMM and/or CTI-CMM maturity assessments, gap analyses, and recommending improvements.

Ability to design, implement, and optimise security tooling integrations (e.g., TIPs, SIEMs, orchestration platforms). This is not a software development role, but the ability to also build prototype tooling is highly desirable.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate client needs into actionable technical solutions.

High autonomy and ability to work without supervision, while contributing effectively in a team.

Excellent communication skills, both client-facing and internal, with the ability to engage technical and executive stakeholders.

Strong collaboration skills using remote working technologies.

Ability to self-educate and quickly learn new technologies, frameworks, and methodologies.

Attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities.

Flexibility to handle changes to processes and procedures as we grow




Desirable

A list of skills that would be valuable, but are not required. Feel free to apply even if you don't have any of these skills:

Experience being part of a CTI programme.

Hands-on experience with MISP, Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs), SIEMs, SOAR, or related security tools.

Cloud and network security architecture experience (AWS, Azure, GCP).

Scripting or development skills (Python, Typescript, PowerShell, .NET).

Prior experience conducting or facilitating cybersecurity tabletop exercises (TTX).

Have carried out threat-informed threat modelling.

Experience writing and improving incident response playbooks.

Familiarity with security automation, AI/LLMs, and data visualisation in a CTI/SOC context.

Training delivery experience in CTI, SOC operations, or related domains.

Experience contributing to open-source security tools or communities.


About Cosive

What we do

Cosive is a specialist consultancy for cyber threat intelligence (CTI) and security operations (SecOps). We offer cybersecurity consultancy services, perform custom software development, run training courses, resell some select products, and notably we develop our own software service offerings: CloudMISP, MalwareZoo and Antifraud. We have a strong software development and engineering capability underpinning our SecOps and CTI services.

Our approach

We operate as a specialist trusted partner with our clients, working together to help them improve their security posture over time. We build close relationships with our clients and often work with them over multiple engagements over multiple years. Honesty, integrity, and trust are core values of our business.

We are a fully virtual company, with all staff working remotely from home or a co-working space if preferred. We are primarily based in Australia and New Zealand. All communications are carried out via chat room, email, and videoconferencing.

We often deal with international overseas companies. This fact means that occasionally you may be required to start early or work late in order to attend a meeting involving someone from another timezone. This is one of the reasons we have a flexible working hours policy for staff to enable them to build their work schedule around their own lifestyle. Domestic and international travel may occasionally be required to support our customers or attend conferences.

Cosive’s value stems from our people and their talent. We have a staff-first approach to workloads and the engagements we take on and we respect that each of the members of our team are experienced, capable professionals with a life outside of work. We don’t clock-watch or micromanage our team; we rely on everyone’s ability to work autonomously and collaborate when necessary to achieve good outcomes. We expect staff to be proactive and self-driven, and to always be looking for ways to contribute positively to our team.

We want you to gain as much from working at Cosive as Cosive gains from your skills, so we provide staff training opportunities, both internal and external, to ensure that your skills stay relevant and that you can eventually take that next step in your career.

We care about our staff's wellbeing. We know the impact that the stress of intensive work can have on people. This is why for the last few years, we've been giving each staff member an extra day of leave each month to use for their mental health in addition to their annual leave. We call this the Cosive ME day. Please note the Cosive ME day is an additional gift provided by Cosive and is discretionary, and does not form part of your standard remuneration package.

You can get a bit more insight into how we work here.

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst – Expression of Interest
Ad Text:
Federal Government agencies delivering multi-year transformation program to modernise systems and improve digital services for Australians.
 
Known for stability, long tenure, and meaningful mission-driven work, the agency values collaboration, accountability, and a commitment to public service.
 
The Opportunity

We are seeking Expressions of Interest from experienced Technical Business Analysts from Canberra or relocating to Canberra, interested in upcoming Federal Government opportunities. These roles are part of high-profile ICT programs that require strong analytical capability, stakeholder engagement, and technical documentation skills.
 
This is your chance to contribute to one of the country’s most significant digital initiatives while building on your government contracting career.
 
The Role

As a Technical Business Analyst, you will:

Gather, analyse, and document business and technical requirements
Work closely with solution architects, developers, and testers to translate requirements into system functionality
Map business processes and identify areas for improvement or automation
Develop functional specifications, user stories, and acceptance criteria
Facilitate workshops with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Support system integration, testing, and implementation activities
Ensure alignment with agency standards, compliance, and security requirements
The Ideal Person

You’re an experienced Business Analyst who thrives in structured, Agile environments and has strong technical knowledge across ICT projects.
 
You’re comfortable bridging the gap between business and technology teams and producing clear, actionable documentation.
 
You’ll bring:

Proven experience as a Business Analyst in complex ICT programs (federal government preferred)
Strong background in requirements gathering, process mapping, and documentation
Familiarity with Agile delivery practices and tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence, DevOps)
Understanding of system integration, data migration, or modernisation projects
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
The ability to balance multiple priorities while delivering quality outcomes
It’s a bonus if you have:

Experience in cyber, data, or enterprise system modernisation projects
BABOK or IIBA certifications
Prior experience in secure government environments
Please note this opportunity is only open to Australian Citizen’s with minimum Baseline Clearance as per the requirement of the Federal Government.
 
Salary / Rate
$120/hr - $150/hr including 12% Superannuation
How to Apply

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link.
 
Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Antony Austin or Prajjwal K C on 02 6108 4878 quoting ref no. 20931.
 
HorizonOne is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and we encourage applications from people of all cultures, capabilities and backgrounds.

Data Engineer – Entertainment Technology | Melbourne | Hybrid
  
Are you passionate about designing scalable data solutions that power cutting-edge digital experiences? We’re partnering with a leading entertainment technology company seeking a talented Data Engineer to join their growing team. This is your opportunity to work on high-impact projects in a fast-paced environment that champions innovation, collaboration, and professional growth.
  
Why You’ll Love This Role

Tackle Complex Challenges: Work on advanced data projects that push boundaries and require creative, scalable solutions.
Accelerate Your Career: Gain access to mentorship, structured learning programs, and real-world experience that will take your skills to the next level.
Collaborate with the Best: Join a team of highly skilled engineers driving innovation across the entertainment industry.
Supportive Culture: Be part of an organisation that genuinely invests in your career progression and celebrates your achievements.
Shape the Future: Contribute to data-driven decisions that influence millions of users globally.  
About the Team
You’ll be joining a Data Engineering team dedicated to building a world-class data platform that centralises and unlocks the full potential of data across the business. The team manages data from both in-house products and third-party services, ensuring it’s reliable, scalable, and ready to power next-generation analytics and machine learning initiatives.
  
What You’ll Do

Design, develop, and maintain scalable ETL pipelines using AWS Glue and Airflow.
Build secure and efficient data systems on AWS, leveraging Terraform for infrastructure as code.
Transform and model data in Redshift using dbt, enabling high-quality analytics and insights.
Optimise pipelines for performance, cost-efficiency, and scalability, ensuring observability with monitoring and alerting systems.
Implement data governance practices including lineage, classification, access control, and compliance (e.g., GDPR).
Develop and optimise real-time data pipelines (PySpark, Glue Spark, Kinesis) with Change Data Capture (CDC).
Contribute to peer code reviews, maintain documentation, and ensure best practices are followed.
What We’re Looking For

Hands-on experience in data engineering, with expertise in ETL, data modelling, and real-time pipelines.
Strong skills in SQL, Python, or PySpark, with experience across AWS services such as Glue, Redshift, Kinesis, Lambda, S3, and DMS.
Familiarity with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow), version control (e.g., GitHub), and big data technologies (e.g., Spark or Hadoop).
Experience designing and implementing modern cloud-based data platforms using IaC tools like Terraform.
Knowledge of data governance and compliance standards.
Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Bonus Points:

Exposure to DataOps principles, CI/CD, and agile methodologies.
Knowledge of machine learning concepts and their application in data engineering.
AWS certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect, Data Analytics) or similar.

About us   

At Healthdirect Australia we work with purpose and dedication to help Australians actively manage and improve their health.
  
Our virtual services are easily accessible via multiple channels, including helplines, video call solutions and websites and cater for Australians at all stages of life. No matter where people live, or what time of the day or night it is, they can use our services to talk to a health professional, find trusted information and advice online and locate their closest health service.

About the opportunity

This is a unique opportunity to shape a newly established role and the future of data and AI governance at Healthdirect. As the Data and AI Governance Advisor, you will build our governance approach from the ground up, advise internal stakeholders, uplift capability, and embed governance pathways to ensure data and emerging technologies are used safely, responsibly, and effectively.

You will play a pivotal role in key strategic initiatives, including Consumer Identity, AI Governance, and Data Utilisation.

Key Responsibilities:

Translate strategic vision into actionable outcomes and embed governance elements into high-impact initiatives.
Lead as a trusted advisor, offering expert guidance on emerging data and AI governance challenges.
Provide expert advice on data and AI governance and associated risks, ensuring alignment with regulatory and organisational standards.
Drive cross-functional collaboration and build shared ownership of key data and AI governance initiatives.
You can contribute through your:

Tertiary qualifications in information management, law, data science, technology, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of data governance experience.
Demonstrated experience in data and/or AI governance in a complex organisational setting.
Familiarity with data protection laws, ethical AI principles, and data management standards.
Experience in developing or implementing data and AI governance frameworks, policies, or governance tools.
Why work with us

We believe our strength comes from our talented and dedicated staff. We are committed to working together to create a culture where you can bring your whole self to work.
  
Our benefits include:

Flexible work arrangements (2 days per week in office, pro-rated for part time employees);
14 weeks company Paid Parental Leave for both parents;
Multi-dimensional wellbeing program that is run by our people for our people;
Individual curated learner journeys to support you to expand your capabilities and unlock your talent.
To find out more about Healthdirect, and our vision for a healthier Australia, please visit our website - about.healthdirect.gov.au

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce. 

Click Apply to submit your application for this role. Please be aware that you must have the right to live and work in Australia to apply for this job.

Change Analyst (Finance) - ERP Transformation Program

Location: Brisbane | Contract: Initial term with possible extensions

We're seeking a highly skilled Change Analyst (Finance) to play a pivotal role in a major SAP S/4HANA implementation within a large-scale ERP transformation program. This is an exciting opportunity to help drive organisational change, improve business processes, and support the adoption of a modern, cloud-based ERP platform.

About the Role

Reporting to the Business Readiness Lead (Finance), you will support the execution of the finance change management strategy, ensuring stakeholders are engaged, business units are prepared, and employees have the tools and training needed for a smooth transition.

Key Responsibilities

Assist in delivering the finance change management plan, aligned with ERP transformation goals.

Conduct change impact assessments to identify role and process impacts.

Coordinate stakeholder engagement, communications, and training activities.

Support development of training programs, scheduling, and completion tracking.

Assist with business readiness assessments to ensure teams are prepared for go-live.

Track adoption metrics, gather feedback, and identify improvement areas.

Prepare change reports and maintain communication materials for leadership.

What We're Looking For

5+ years experience in change management, finance transformation, or business process change within large-scale projects.

Knowledge of Prosci ADKAR, Kotter's Change Model, or similar frameworks.

Experience with Finance and Budgeting system implementations (preferably SAP S/4HANA).

Familiarity with finance processes such as Period End Close, Reporting, Treasury, Accounts Receivable, Asset Accounting.

Strong communication, stakeholder engagement, and organisational skills.

Desirable:

Government or large enterprise experience.

Background in finance policy, budgeting, or treasury activities.

Exposure to SAP Activate methodology.

Why Join?

This is your chance to be part of a transformative program that will streamline operations, enhance customer experience, and deliver long-term efficiency improvements across a complex organisation.
