Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Our client is looking for an Implementation Lead / Product Owner with Model Risk & System Implementation experience. This is a Business-focused role.

They are seeking an experienced Implementation Lead / Product Owner to drive the delivery of model risk and system implementation initiatives. This role will bridge the gap between business stakeholders, project teams, and risk management, ensuring robust governance, compliance, and successful deployment of risk models and associated systems. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in model risk management (Financial risk or Treasury/Credit risk), financial services, and system implementation, with the ability to define requirements, prioritize delivery, and oversee execution across the full project lifecycle.

Responsibilities

Act as an Implementation / Product Owner for model risk and system implementation initiatives, defining and maintaining the product road-map and backlog.

Collaborate with stakeholders (risk, compliance, finance, IT, data science, and operations) to gather, document, and prioritize requirements.

Lead the end-to-end system implementation process, including design, testing, integration, and deployment.

Ensure systems comply with model risk management frameworks, regulatory requirements, and internal governance policies.

Partner with technology teams to validate model deployment, integration, and monitoring capabilities.

Manage stakeholder communications, including progress updates, risk/issues reporting, and change management activities.

Drive continuous improvements in system processes, governance, and controls related to model lifecycle management.

Ensure data quality, lineage, and transparency across risk and model platforms.

Requirements

Proven experience as an Implementation Lead or Product Owner in financial services sector.

Strong experience in Financial Risk or Treasury Risk/Credit Risk - A MUST

Strong understanding of Model Risk Management (MRM), governance, validation, and regulatory frameworks (e.g., SR 11-7, Basel, IFRS 9, CCAR).

Experience in system implementation projects (risk management platforms, financial systems, or model lifecycle management tools).

Excellent skills in requirement gathering, backlog prioritization, and stakeholder management.

Hands-on experience with Agile delivery methodologies and product management tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence).

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Ability to translate complex risk and technical concepts into clear, actionable requirements.

If you think you have the above skills and experiences, click the 'Apply' button or send your resume to alex.nguyen@talentinternational.com

Company: KBR - Kellogg Brown & Root Pty Ltd
Ad Text:
Join us today!

 We are renowned for working in partnership with our clients and construction partners to deliver exceptional outcomes based on our collaborative approach and our “One Team” value.  

 In Australia, KBR employ over 2000 people with offices in each state. Our project delivery track record, industry profile and strong relationships have enabled us to grow significantly, and we continue to expand. This continued growth allows us to offer unrivalled opportunities to our staff in terms of career paths, career development and project exposure. 

 Creating a superb culture is also huge for us and a key part of our success and growth. Genuine collaboration across the business is integral to how we work. As a company KBR have created an open, inclusive organisation where people matter, are valued, and cared about. By joining KBR you can be assured that you are joining a team that pulls in the same direction and shares common values.

The Opportunity

Due to the retirement of the long serving incumbent KBR has a position for a Senior Financial Planning and Analysis individual who will lead reporting, forecasting and insightful analysis. The role offers long term career development opportunities and will expose you to a range of projects across the Australian KBR business.

We are looking for a switched on, motivated individual with 10+ years of experience wanting to take the next step in their career to a more senior role. It is important that you have a strong technical accounting background with a good knowledge of accounting standards.

Key Responsibilities of the role include:

Manage the Financial Planning & Analysis role for KBR Infrastructure Solutions business.Ensure Internal reporting deadlines are achieved

Manage the forecasting and budgeting process for the business

Develop partnerships with key personnel within the business

Provide value added financial services, analysis and support to the business, as required

Oversee the month end accounting processes, identification and resolution of issues.

Oversee the preparation of Joint Venture accounts and provide oversight to ensure compliance with accounting policies and procedures

Who are you?

To be successful in this role you require 10+ years’ experience in a similar role and have a degree qualification in Finance/commerce. You must have strong communication & presenting skills along with advanced proficiency with financial modelling, planning and excel.

Other requirements include:

Solid accounting background with professional organisation membership – CA or CPA

Strong IT skills and experience using Power BI and digital applications an advantage.

experience with a large ERP system.

Who are we?

KBR’s Infrastructure Solutions Australia business offers a wide range of professional services to private and public sector clients delivering projects in both urban and remote environments across transport, water, environment, buildings and defence. 

We are committed to social and environmental sustainability and delivering projects with a digital mindset that drives innovation within our business, for our customers and stakeholders.   Our continued growth allows us to offer unrivalled opportunities to our staff in terms of career paths, career development and project exposure. 

Find out more about us via these links:

IS Australia overview brochure: 

https://kbr.foleon.com/is-australia/who-we-are/

At KBR, we value you – here’s how. 

While our people are busy delivering leading science, technology, and engineering solutions, we’re committed to providing them with a supportive, trusting environment and benefits that enable them to thrive and continue doing what they do best. 

Benefits include:

Industry leading salaries reviewed annually.  

20 Days of annual leave Leave per year + an additional day off every 4 weeks (33 days in total)  

Flexible work arrangements (start/finish times, WFH, Flex time) 

Salary packaging and novated leases  

Paid professional membership fees

Life/Health insurance discounts 

Employee stock purchase plans  

Paid parental leave

Personal career development plans  

Growth and promotion opportunities 

Help shape tomorrow by applying today! 

Don’t miss out on this opportunity to leave your impact on our society with one of Australia’s leading infrastructure businesses. Apply now and follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date with all the latest news and job opportunities.

Our client is a global consulting firm that partners with organisations to tackle their most pressing business challenges across technology, digital, risk and compliance, analytics, and internal audit. This firm is known for its collaborative and tailored approach.
 
They work with prominent clients across the Federal government. Their inclusive culture, commitment to integrity, and focus on innovation make them a trusted advisor and an excellent place to build a career.
 
The Opportunity

Step into a unique leadership opportunity in their fast-growing Canberra office, as part of a prominent global firm that supports over 80% of the Fortune 100. This is your chance to shape the direction of a high-performing Project Assurance team while partnering with boards, executives, and senior leaders from some of Australia’s most recognised organisations.
 
What sets this opportunity apart is the possibility to step into a high-performing culture, supported by an environment that prioritises your professional and personal growth.  With tailored progression and promotion plans based on merit, you’ll benefit from accelerated career development, supported by an Advisory program that supports both your professional and personal journey. You’ll also have access to global opportunities through a dedicated Global Mobility program. Here, ambition and wellbeing meet opportunity and care.

The Role

As Senior Manager of Project Assurance, you’ll lead critical advisory services across major technology transformation projects, helping clients navigate delivery risks and make confident decisions.
 
Key responsibilities include:

Leading project assurance reviews across high-impact technology transformations, including governance, delivery, risk, and change management.
Advising C-suite and project boards on risk, delivery health, and strategic improvements to ensure successful outcomes.
Implementing risk management practices to identify, mitigate, and manage risks during all stages of projects and foster a risk-aware culture among project teams.
Mentoring and developing high-performing teams, while driving continuous improvement and best practice standards.
The Ideal Person

You’re an experienced manager with six or more years in professional services, bringing proven expertise in at least two of the following areas:

Technology strategy and operations
Improving IT operations and infrastructure
Managing technology risks
You’re passionate about leading teams, delivering complex engagements, and working alongside prominent senior stakeholders.

With a high performing and collaborative mindset, you’re committed to mentoring others and making a meaningful impact.

You’re likely to come from a Big 4 or other consulting firm, with stable tenure and a track record of success.

Salary / Rate
$135k - $160k + Super
Permanent full-time position
Centrally located Office
How to Apply

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link.
 
Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Alan Larby on 02 6108 4878 quoting ref no. 20626
 
HorizonOne is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and we encourage applications from people of all cultures, capabilities and backgrounds.

Job Title: Senior Corporate Finance Analyst | Big 4 Transaction Services
Category: Corporate Finance & Investment Banking (Banking & Financial Services)
Ad Text:
High profile Infrastructure giant is amid large-scale transformation. The business is a complex organisation, given its scale and operations.
We are seeking a high-performing Senior Corporate Finance Analyst with a strong consulting or corporate finance background to support the execution of a complex, multi-year asset divestment and operational transition.

This is a unique opportunity to work at the centre of a landmark transaction, with exposure to senior stakeholders, and multidisciplinary workstreams. This role is initially 6-month contract with good chance of extension.

Key duties (but not limited to):

Act as the central liaison between internal teams and external advisors, ensuring smooth communication and timely issue resolution
Lead and manage the virtual data room, maintaining document control and compliance protocols
Coordinate investor queries and RFI responses, ensuring alignment and accuracy of all materials
Prepare high-quality updates, briefings, and documentation for senior executives and government stakeholders
Key criteria to be considered:

5-7 years’ experience, ideally from a top-tier consulting firm or Big 4 Transaction Services/Corporate finance background is well-suited  
Exposure to complex transformations, M&A, carve-outs or infrastructure transactions
Sector experience in infrastructure, industrials or other capital-intensive industries
Exceptional communication and stakeholder management
Does this sound like you? Interested? Please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this position contact our retained recruitment Partner Dan Webb at Acquire Talent.

Research Impact and Evaluation Manager


The National Breast Cancer Foundation (NBCF) is Australia's leading not-for-profit organisation funding world-class breast cancer research towards our vision of Zero Deaths from breast cancer.
Newly created role in a time of growth, working closely with a visionary Executive Director to deliver NBCF’s ambitious Pink Horizon Research Strategy.
Hybrid work environment, NFP salary packaging, and an opportunity to work with a passionate team in a mission-driven organisation.
  
  
About The National Breast Cancer Foundation
  
The National Breast Cancer Foundation (NBCF) is Australia's leading not-for-profit organisation funding world-class breast cancer research towards our vision of Zero Deaths from breast cancer. Since our inception in 1994, NBCF has invested over $200 million into more than 600 world-class research projects across Australia. In this time, death rate from breast cancer in Australia has reduced by 40%. 
  
We've seen remarkable results, but the job's not done. 
  
At NBCF, we’re determined to create a better tomorrow. We know research matters, and it is central and critical to improving breast cancer outcomes. That’s why our pioneering Pink Horizon Research Strategy supports a diverse yet connected portfolio of research at a scale of investment that matches the boldness of our vision. 
  
With a highly talented and committed team, and an enviable reputation, NBCF is well positioned to achieve even greater outcomes over the coming years and change the future for all those diagnosed with breast cancer, and we would love you to join us. 

Find out more here: https://nbcf.org.au/research-strategy/   
  

Role responsibilities

Reporting to the Executive Director of Research in this exciting and newly created role, the Research Impact and Evaluation Manager will play a part in NBCF’s vision of Zero Deaths from breast cancer.
  
You will design, rollout, and refine a suite of evaluation/impact frameworks to ensure that NBCF’s investment across its grant portfolio (Collaborative Research Accelerators (CRAs), Research Project Grants (RPGs), and Pink Sky Grants), are effectively monitored and measured, allowing stories to be shared to demonstrate strategic progress and real-world impact.


Work closely with the Head of Research, Head of Grants Administration, Research Program Development Manager, and other key stakeholders to embed robust evaluation and impact measurement practices/activities across all research schemes and strategic initiatives.
Build impact and evaluation measurement and reporting frameworks for all NBCF grant schemes, aligning with the Pink Horizon Research Strategy’s four strategic objectives.
Develop and apply indicators/metrics across short-, medium-, and long-term horizons to measure research outputs, outcomes; and maintain NBCF’s Impact Measurement and Reporting Matrix (ensuring data integrity, and consistency).
Generate insights and visualisations from research data to inform internal strategic decision-making and external reporting requirements.
Prepare and contribute to high-quality reports, presentations, case studies, and impact narratives for diverse audiences including the Board, Research Advisory Committee (RAC), donors, and the community.
Develop and manage tools, and provide training and support for grant recipients, on impact reporting, narrative development, and evidence collection.
Be an internal subject matter expert on impact/evaluation methodologies – horizon scan and review evolving trends, to ensure practise remains world-class and aligned with sector standards.
  
  
Essential Requirements
  
To excel in this role, you will be analytical as well as strategic, with robust experience in impact measurement and evaluation, and communicating those insights to diverse audiences.
  
You will be proactive, with a growth mindset; and thrive in a fast-paced environment. You will enjoy collaborating closely in a tight-knit, passionate team, enabling impactful breast cancer research.
  

Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline such as public health, life/social sciences (PhD or Master’s degree highly desirable).
Extensive experience in research evaluation, impact assessment, or performance measurement in a health or medical research context (experience working within grant-funding organisations, particularly in the not-for-profit sector highly regarded).
Exceptional skills with data analysis (both qualitative and quantitative), and proven experience creating evaluation and impact measurement frameworks, metrics, and reporting tools aligned with strategic objectives.
High level of computer literacy, including experience with data analysis/visualisation tools, research databases, and Microsoft Office applications.
Strong project management and organisational skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Advanced written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to story-tell when presenting research/evaluation findings, and tailor communications to a wide range of audiences and stakeholders.
Demonstrated stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to work collaboratively across teams and with external partners.
  
How to Apply

To be considered for this position, please apply now with your resume and a tailored cover letter directly through the advertisement. If you have any further questions, please contact Diana Linde at diana@beaumontpeople.com.au.
  
Applications will be assessed as they are received.

At Beaumont People we believe a diverse workplace is a happy workplace, and we love working with organisations that feel the same way.  We encourage applications from people of all different backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from CALD backgrounds and people with disabilities.
  
We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital or parental status. Should you require a reasonable accommodation to be made for your application to be assessed we would be more than happy to discuss how that can be arranged.

Job Title: EOI | EL2 Director, Enterprise Strategy, Digital and Data Division
Ad Text:
The branch 

ONI’s Digital and Data Division (Division) designs and delivers technology solutions and services that underpin ONI’s day-to-day operations, as well as leads broader digital and data initiatives across the National Intelligence Community (NIC).

The Digital Support Office (DSO) leads enterprise strategy development and provides portfolio management and coordination across the Division. It drives best practice in governance and performance reporting for ONI and NIC digital initiatives.

The DSO brings together the enabling functions of the Division – such as governance, program management, procurement and contract management, enterprise strategy and architecture. It also has a focus on interoperability and resilience, and drives improved digital and data workforce planning and digital and data skilling uplift across ONI.
In the DSO, the Enterprise Strategy team leads the development, implementation, and governance of enterprise architecture frameworks within ONI, including setting the strategic technology priorities to guide ONI’s transformation and ensure alignment with organisational goals. More broadly, the team drives collaborative technology strategy across the NIC, shaping shared priorities and fostering alignment.

The Enterprise Strategy team also coordinates and centralises architectural advice and governance in ONI, to ensure technical decisions are effective and consistent with enterprise strategies.

The roles

This role presents a unique opportunity to lead enterprise technology strategy and architecture within ONI, while also shaping and influencing digital transformation across the broader NIC.

We are seeking an experienced EL2 to lead the Enterprise Strategy team.

As Director, your role would be to:

drive the development, execution and review of strategies and roadmaps to guide ONI and NIC technology enhancement and change, including moving to Cloud services
support alignment of systems integration activities and recommend future improvements
provide specialist advice to the Division, including the Chief Information Officer and Chief Data Officer, supporting the provision of standardised architectural governance and decision making
facilitate engagement across the NIC to identify and pursue solutions to promote technological interoperability and resilience
ensure governance, compliance and risk management (including cyber) in architectural processes
work across the NIC to track progress made on digital and enterprise technology investment, including supporting committees that aid decision-making in this area, and industry outreach
build and maintain positive working relationships across ONI, the NIC, industry and with external partners to address ONI, NIC and Australian digital and data priorities.


Key attributes

To be successful in this role you will need to demonstrate:

be able to lead a team of technical professionals to provide advice and support to ONI’s digital and data enterprise,
provide sound strategic advice and judgment to support decision making,
communicate effectively both within and across the team, Division, agency and NIC,
be able to operate in a high-tempo and diverse environment that relies on the ability to be adaptable and flexible, including prioritising support to fit Divisional priorities, and
have demonstrated Enterprise Architecture Experience (including development of technology roadmaps, understanding of government ICT policy standards).



Highly Desirable qualifications include:

Bachelor degree and/or Postgraduate qualifications in a relevant field such as:
Information Technology
Computer Science
Information Systems
Engineering
Business / Public Policy (with a tech/strategy focus)
Business / Public Policy (with a tech/strategy focus)
ITIL, COBIT, or other service management/governance frameworks
Project / Program Management certifications

 

Candidate information kit

Does this sound like you? Interested? Please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this position contact our retained recruitment Partner Dan Webb at Acquire Talent.

Oracle Health AI (OHAI) is Oracle’s center of innovation for applying advanced artificial intelligence to the most critical challenges in healthcare and enterprise. Leveraging Oracle’s extensive cloud resources and rich healthcare data assets, our multidisciplinary team of scientists, engineers, and clinicians develops leading-edge AI solutions—such as large language models and generative AI—that drive smarter decisions, automate workflows, and improve outcomes at scale. At OHAI, we are dedicated to translating the latest breakthroughs in AI into practical, responsible, and impactful technology for clinicians, patients, and organizations worldwide.

We are seeking a visionary Senior Manager to lead the team to scalable, production-ready generative AI solutions in healthcare and enterprise domains. As a people manager and technical leader, you will collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and clinical teams, leveraging the latest advances in Generative AI to drive product development. 

Responsibilities: 

Strategic Leadership & Vision

Define and drive the AI research and development strategy for healthcare solutions, aligned with organizational goals and regulatory requirements.
Identify opportunities where Gen AI can deliver measurable improvements in clinical workflows, patient workflows, and healthcare operations.
Act as a thought leader, staying abreast of advances in AI, healthcare informatics, and regulatory landscapes, and translating them into actionable innovation roadmaps.

Team & Talent Development

Lead, mentor, and grow a team of applied scientists, machine learning engineers, and data scientists to deliver impactful AI solutions.
Foster a culture of innovation, scientific rigor, and collaboration across multidisciplinary teams including clinicians, product managers, and engineers.
Provide career development guidance, performance management, and technical mentorship to elevate the team’s capabilities.

AI Solution Development & Delivery

Oversee the end-to-end lifecycle of AI projects, from problem definition, data acquisition, and model development to deployment and monitoring in clinical or operational environments.
Ensure models are built with high standards for accuracy, latency, fairness, explainability, and compliance with healthcare regulations (HIPAA, GDPR, FDA, TGA, etc.).
Partner with product and engineering teams to translate research prototypes into production-ready, scalable, and reliable AI solutions.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

Collaborate with clinicians, healthcare domain experts, and business stakeholders to ensure AI solutions address real-world pain points and integrate seamlessly into workflows.
Communicate technical results, risks, and trade-offs effectively to executive leadership and non-technical stakeholders.

Impact Measurement

Define success metrics for AI initiatives, ensuring outcomes are measured in terms of healthcare impact, operational efficiency, and business value.
Continuously evaluate deployed models, leading efforts to monitor drift, drive improvements as needed and maintain product excellence over different stages of the product.

Qualifications and Experience: 

Education & Experience

Master’s or PhD in AI/Gen AI, Machine Learning or related technical field.
5+ years of experience in AI/Gen AI or Machine Learning, with 1-3 years in a leadership/managerial role overseeing applied science or AI research teams.
Have led a team size of 5+ members to deliver product releases. 

Technical Expertise

Proven track record of building and deploying AI or Gen AI solutions in production environments.
Strong understanding of ML/DL/AI, NLP, computer vision, or multimodal learning as applied to different application domains.
Hands-on experience as applied scientists delivering AI/Gen AI products, models, patents, and/or papers in the past. 

Leadership & Collaboration

Demonstrated ability to lead, mentor, and grow teams of applied scientists or machine learning engineers.
Proven ability to thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous environments while maintaining scientific rigor and compliance discipline.
Strong track record of cross-functional collaboration with domain experts, product managers, and engineering teams.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Exceptional leadership presence and ability to influence at executive and board levels.

Preferred Qualifications

Medical domain Knowledge 

Familiarity with healthcare standards and data formats (e.g., HL7, FHIR, DICOM, ICD-10, CPT).
Experience working with clinical, claims, or operational healthcare datasets, with an understanding of privacy/security requirements (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR).

Operational & Business Acumen

Strong business sense with the ability to connect AI innovation to healthcare ROI, patient outcomes, and strategic priorities.

#LI-DNI

As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity. 

We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing 

accommodation-request_mb@oracle.com or by calling +1 888 404 2494 in the United States.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
